content.description:
Climbs better than it looks... but not that much better.
Easy climbing up the blocky corner leads to a tough move pulling an offwidth with a flake inside.  The flake seemed solid, but I wouldn't want to really put it to the test

This small corner located at the far left of the main wall at Exfoliated.  It is located about 3 meters to the left of "Trouble With Lichen".
Standard rack. Tree anchor.

Climb up and right on a short face past a bolt to get to a good stance and optional piece of gear (the climbing is easy, but a fall would be bad). Follow bolts up the gently overhanging wall.

Starts about 5m left from the big roof.
bolts, optional mid sized cam between the first and second bolts. bolted anchor

Climbs a nice face split by a couple of horizontal cracks.

Located at the far right of Exfoliated this climb starts by mantling up onto a ledge.  From the ledge climb the enjoyable face with limited but good protection.
Small gear to a tree anchor.

A bolt protects the tricky start to this climb.  Once you are past the bolt the climbing eases off in terms of difficulty but remains fun throughout.  The tree anchor is now dead, so I traversed left near the top and went to the Farewell to Arms anchors.



There is a large roof that splits the cliff.  The left side of this roof ends in a corner.  The juggler is located just past this corner.

4 bolts, single rack .3 to 2.  Dead Tree/Quick Clips (see description)

Despite the grade this route is surprisingly tough.  The main line climbs up the corner, although there are variations which climb out the overhang to the left (5.9) and up the face without using the corner (5.8).  These route offer limited gear and are almost always done on top rope.

The gear on this route can be tricky to find.  In 2018 a climber ripped out a few pieces and took a ground fall on this route.  Luckily no major injuries were sustained and he was back to climbing within the week.  

Luckily a top rope can easily be set up on this route if you want to enjoy the climbing without the fear.

This route climbs the obvious corner on the right side of Exfoliated.  It is the first thing you will encounter if you approach from Joe's/L-Shape
Standard Rack.

If it was one continuous climb and not separated by a big ledge it would be even better but hey there are lots of routes like that. The boulder problem off the ground is somewhat spicey but there is a bomber nut that protects the first move and then more gear after you get established in the open book. After gaining the ledge move up and left to a shallow corner. Climb up  the corner clipping a pin then pull the crux. Enjoyable, steep climbing the rest of the way.

About 10 meters right of Sleeping beauty. The start is on a ledge 2 meters above the trail. 
Single rack to 3" piece. Tree anchor. Rap the route.

climbs.name: Return to Neverland
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes and Dom Caron,  June 2020

content.description:
Ascend the short, steep wall to a horizontal crack just below the ledge. Try your best to gracefully mantle up onto the ledge using whatever you can. After gaining the big ledge step up and slightly right to a thin crack below a flaring offwidth/chimney like feature. Small gear protects this short cruxy section, then follow cracks and jugs up to a corner below a double roof. Traverse right under the first roof then up on good holds to surmount the roof. Continue up to a tree anchor.

Start about 2 meters right of Rescuers below and left of a tree on a ledge.
Single rack to 2" piece. Long draws are essential. Tree anchor. Rap the route.

climbs.name: Sacred Planet
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes and Dom Caron,  June 2020

content.description:
Climb the start of Rescuers Down Under and move up to the ledge. Step up and slightly right to a bolt. Continue up the face on good edges to a short low angled slab. Clip another bolt and then move up to a cool undercling flake. Step left then continue almost straight up on the arete with huge holds and nice exposure until you reach a crack riddled face. Continue up the face to the top of the cliff. This route shares the same start as Rescuers Down Under.

Single rack to 3. 2 bolts. Tree anchor. Rap the route.

climbs.name: Saludos Amigos
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes and Francois Cote, June 2020

content.description:
Climb on large holds and features to a ledge. Move up and slightly right on discontinuous cracks to a large ledge with a tree

Located about 4 meters right of Sleeping Beauty on a ledge 2 meters above the trail.
Single rack to 1 inch piece. Tree anchor. Rap the route.

A tricky start leads to easier climbing in the middle section.  Regain some energy and head up to the definitive (some consider reachy) crux at the last bolt.

The route is located directly behind a large table sized boulder in the middle of Exfoliated
7 Bolts.  The 6th bolt is located slightly off route.  Clip it with a long draw or bring a cam or two to plug in to prevent rope drag.

climbs.name: Smouldering Action
climbs.fa: F. Côté, C. Trafton, F. Corbett 2020

content.description:
Start left of the first bolt on good holds. Move up and right to the bolt then pull the overlap and move into the corner. When the corner ends, continue up the face to rap rings.

Start near the right end of the arching roof feature.
5 bolts. rap rings

Climb up a crimpy face to a few horizontals. A couple big moves will take you to lower angled easy climbing. Follow easy cracks to a small roof. Pull the roof and continue up to a tree.

a few meters right of the blocky corner, at the left end of the cliff.
bolts, a light rack of cams, tree anchor

Often seeping but worth doing when it's dry.
Climb up the face then pull a bouldery crux out and over the roof. Continue up the face to quick clip anchor.

Climbs the widest section of the roof near the left end of Exfoliated wall
5 bolts. quick clips
The climbs at Exfoliated tend to stay wet and shaded due to the large trees located at its base.  It is easy to top rope most of the routes here as most use tree anchors at the top of the cliff.
